Class AsyncSendHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • AsyncSendHelper

  • public class AsyncSendHelper
extends java.lang.Object

      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkAck(Transport transport)
      Handle an incoming acknowledgement; this should be called from TCPSockWrapper.
      void flush()
      Start Async command chain that results in TCP transmission.
      void goBackN()
      Resend all buffered Transports, as the timer has run out.
      boolean hasBufferedTransports()
      Determine if there are some un-acknowledged transports in buffer
      boolean isFlushing()
      Determine if flushing is currently in progress.
      void sendFinSignalNow()
      Send a fin signal now, as the write buff is empty and the TCPSock would like to close.

    • Method Detail

      • checkAck

        public void checkAck(Transport transport)
        Handle an incoming acknowledgement; this should be called from TCPSockWrapper.
        Parameters:
        transport - The incoming ACK signal.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Start Async command chain that results in TCP transmission. Does nothing if write buff is empty, and stop Async command chain.

      • goBackN

        public void goBackN()
        Resend all buffered Transports, as the timer has run out.

      • isFlushing

        public boolean isFlushing()
        Determine if flushing is currently in progress.
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not this helper is currently flushing.

      • hasBufferedTransports

        public boolean hasBufferedTransports()
        Determine if there are some un-acknowledged transports in buffer
        Returns:
        True if there are buffered transports

      • sendFinSignalNow

        public void sendFinSignalNow()
        Send a fin signal now, as the write buff is empty and the TCPSock would like to close.
